<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>RECENT DEVELOPMENTS </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>The following discussion of PEMEX&#146;s 
recent results should be read in conjunction with the annual report on Form 20-F
of
Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos for the fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31, 2011, as 
filed with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (which we refer to as the
SEC) on April&nbsp;30, 2012 (which we refer to as the Form 20-F) and, in 
particular,
&#147;Item 4&#151;Information on the Company&#148; and &#147;Item 
5&#151;Operating and Financial Review and Prospects&#148; in the Form 20-F, and 
with the unaudited condensed consolidated interim financial statements of PEMEX 
included in this report
beginning on page F-1. In this document, &#147;PEMEX&#148; refers to 
Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos, to Pemex-Exploraci&oacute;n y Producci&oacute;n 
(Pemex-Exploration and Production), Pemex-Refinaci&oacute;n (Pemex-Refining), 
Pemex-Gas y
Petroqu&iacute;mica B&aacute;sica (Pemex-Gas and Basic Petrochemicals) and 
Pemex-Petroqu&iacute;mica (Pemex-Petrochemicals) (which we refer to collectively
as the subsidiary entities), and to the subsidiary companies listed in Note 3 to
the 2011
audited financial statements included in the Form 20-F. Petr&oacute;leos 
Mexicanos hereby designates this report on Form 6-K as being incorporated by
reference into (i)&nbsp;the Offering Circular dated December&nbsp;23, 2011, 
relating to its U.S.
$22,000,000,000 Medium-Term Notes Program, Series C, due 1 Year or More from 
Date of Issue and (ii)&nbsp;the Prospectus dated July&nbsp;23, 2012 filed 
pursuant to Rule 424(b)(2) (Commission File No.&nbsp;333-182553). 
</I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Exchange Rates </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">On
August&nbsp;24, 2012, the noon buying rate for cable transfers in New York 
reported by the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System was Ps. 13.1727
= U.S. $1.00. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Selected Financial Data 
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The selected 
financial data as of January&nbsp;1,
2011,&nbsp;December&nbsp;31, 2011 and June&nbsp;30, 2012 and for the six-month 
periods ended June&nbsp;30, 2011 and 2012 have been derived from the unaudited 
condensed consolidated interim financial statements of PEMEX included in this 
report, which
were prepared in accordance with International Financial Reporting Standards, or
IFRS, as issued by the International Accounting Standards Board (IASB). 
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We have begun presenting financial 
statements in accordance with IFRS for the year ending 
December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2012, with an official IFRS &#147;adoption date&#148; of 
January&nbsp;1, 2012 and a
&#147;transition date&#148; to IFRS of January&nbsp;1, 2011. The first-time 
adoption rules are established in IFRS 1 &#147;First-time Adoption of 
International Financial Reporting Standards.&#148; </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">These unaudited condensed consolidated interim 
financial statements have been prepared in accordance with International 
Accounting
Standard (IAS) 34 &#147;Interim Financial Reporting.&#148; IFRS 1 permits us to 
change our elections of optional IFRS transition exemptions even if such 
exemptions have already been used in the preparation of published interim 
financial statements.
If we change policies, classifications or transitions elections prior to the 
issuance of our consolidated financial statements as of and for the year ending 
December&nbsp;31, 2012 as permitted by IFRS 1, we are not required to re-issue 
our financial
statements for previous interim periods. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">In this report, we include selected financial data from our 
statements of financial
position as of January&nbsp;1 and December&nbsp;31, 2011 as well as the 
statement of comprehensive income for the six-month period ended June&nbsp;30, 
2011 for comparison purposes. This comparative data was prepared in accordance 
with IFRS, with the
same criteria as used for the preparation of our statement of financial position
as of June&nbsp;30, 2012 and statement of comprehensive income for the six-month
period ended June&nbsp;30, 2012. </FONT></P>

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="1">(1)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="1">Includes Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos, the subsidiary entities and the 
subsidiary companies listed in Note 3(a) to the unaudited condensed consolidated
interim financial
statements. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="1">(2)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="1">Includes capitalized comprehensive financing result. See Note 3(f) to 
the unaudited condensed consolidated interim financial statements included 
herein.
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="1">(3)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman"
SIZE="1">Earnings, for this purpose, consist of pretax income (loss) from 
continuing operations before income from equity investees, plus fixed charges, 
minus interest
capitalized during the period, plus the amortization of capitalized interest 
during the period and plus dividends received on equity investments. Pretax 
income (loss) is calculated after the deduction of hydrocarbon duties, but 
before the deduction
of the hydrocarbon income tax and other income taxes. Fixed charges for this 
purpose consist of the sum of interest expense plus interest capitalized during 
the period. Fixed charges do not take into account exchange gain or loss 
attributable to
PEMEX&#146;s indebtedness. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-
top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="1"><I>Source: PEMEX&#146;s unaudited condensed consolidated interim 
financial statements, prepared in
accordance with IFRS. </I></FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3 </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Capitalization of PEMEX </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The following table sets forth the 
capitalization of PEMEX at June&nbsp;30, 2012. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-
size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4 </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Information on the Company </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Investment in Repsol 
</I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We hold 
investments in shares of Repsol YPF, S.A.
(which we refer to as Repsol), as described under &#147;Item 4&#151;Information 
on the Company&#151;PEMEX Corporate Matters&#151;Investment in Repsol&#148; and 
&#147;Item 11&#151;Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures about Market
Risk&#151;Instruments Entered Into for Trading Purposes&#148; in the Form 20-F. 
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As described in Note 8 to our 
consolidated
financial statements in the Form 20-F, we recorded the 57,204,240 Repsol shares 
acquired by P.M.I. Holdings, B.V. during 2011 as an &#147;available-for-sale 
investment&#148; and valued our investment in these shares, as of 
December&nbsp;31, 2011, at
approximately U.S. $1.765 billion. The market value of Repsol shares traded on 
the <I>Bolsa de Madrid</I> (Madrid Stock Exchange) has decreased approximately 
40.1% since the end of 2011, from a closing price of &#128;23.74&nbsp;per share 
on
December&nbsp;30, 2011 to a closing price of &#128;14.22&nbsp;per share on 
August&nbsp;23, 2012. Because these Repsol shares are recorded as available-for-
sale, changes in their market value are recognized in the comprehensive result 
component of
our equity and do not affect our results of operations. As of the date of this 
report, we are in the process of evaluating the impact the expropriation of 
Repsol&#146;s YPF shares will have on our investment in Repsol. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5 </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Operating and Financial Review and Prospects </B></FONT></P> 
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I>Results of Operations of 
PEMEX&#151;For the Six Months Ended June&nbsp;30, 2012 Compared to the Six 
Months Ended June&nbsp;30, 2011 </I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>General </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The selected consolidated interim financial 
information set forth below is derived from our unaudited condensed consolidated
interim
financial statements included elsewhere in this report. This interim financial 
information should be read in conjunction with the Form 20-F and, in particular,
&#147;Item 4&#151;Information on the Company&#148; and &#147;Item 
5&#151;Operating and
Financial Review and Prospects&#148; in the Form 20-F, and with the unaudited 
condensed consolidated interim financial statements of PEMEX included in this
report beginning on page F-1. <I>Normas de Informaci&oacute;n Financiera 
Mexicanas</I>
(Mexican Financial Reporting Standards, which we refer to as Mexican FRS) differ
in certain significant respects from IFRS. The principal changes to our 
accounting policies and the effects on our unaudited condensed consolidated 
interim financial
statements resulting from the adoption of IFRS are described in Notes 2 and 13 
to our unaudited condensed consolidated interim financial statements and in 
&#147;Item 5&#151;Operating and Financial Review and Prospects&#151;Recently 
Issued Accounting
Standards&#148; of the Form 20-F. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-

SIZE="2"> 7,964</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT

period</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman"

<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2"> 15,532</FONT></TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman"

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman"

<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman"

<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman"

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">U.S.
$</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">(338</FONT></TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman"

been made at the established exchange rate of Ps. 13.6530 = U.S. $1.00 at 
June&nbsp;30, 2012. Such
translations should not be construed as a representation that the peso amounts 
have been or could be converted into U.S. dollars at the foregoing or any other 
rate. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>

six months of 2012. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-

prepared in
accordance with IFRS. </I></FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6 </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Net sales </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Total revenues increased by 9.6% in
the first six months of 2012, from Ps. 746.0 billion in the first six months of 
2011 to<BR> Ps. 817.4 billion in the first six months of 2012. The increase in 
total
revenues resulted primarily from higher crude oil prices and the increase in the
sales volume of petroleum products. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Domestic Sales </I></FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Domestic sales increased by 10.9% 
in the first six months of 2012, from Ps. 375.5 billion in the first six months 
of 2011 to<BR> Ps. 416.6 billion in the first six months of 2012, primarily due 
to an
increase in the sale price and greater volumes of domestic sales of gasoline, 
diesel, fuel oil and jet fuel. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-
bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">Domestic sales
of petroleum products increased by 16.0% in the first six months of 2012, from 
Ps. 322.6 billion in the first six months of 2011 to Ps. 374.2 billion in the 
first six months of 2012, primarily due to higher sales prices and greater 
volumes of sales
of gasoline, fuel oil, diesel and jet fuel. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">Domestic sales of dry natural gas decreased by 32.2% in the 
first six months of
2012, from Ps. 33.8 billion in the first six months of 2011 to Ps. 22.9 billion 
in the first six months of 2012, primarily due to lower natural gas prices of 
domestic sales. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Domestic petrochemical sales 
(including sales of certain by-products of the petrochemical production process)
increased by 2.1%, from Ps. 19.1 billion in the first six months of 2011 to Ps. 
19.5 billion
in the first six months of 2012, primarily due to higher sales prices and 
greater volumes of petrochemical products such as propylene, toluene, vinyl 
chloride and polyethylene. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Export Sales </I></FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Total export sales (with dollar-
denominated export revenues translated to pesos at the exchange rate on the date
on which the export sale was made) increased by 8.0%, from Ps. 367.8 billion in
the first
six months of 2011 to Ps. 397.3 billion in the first six months of 2012, 
primarily due to higher crude oil prices. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">Excluding
the trading activities of P.M.I. Comercio Internacional, S.A. de C.V. (which we 
refer to as PMI CIM), P.M.I. Trading, Ltd. (which, together with PMI CIM, we 
collectively refer to as the PMI Group) and Mex Gas International, Ltd (MGAS) 
and its
subsidiaries, export sales by the subsidiary entities to the PMI Group and MGAS 
increased by 7.1%, from Ps. 329.9 billion in the first six months of 2011 to Ps.
353.3 billion in the first six months of 2012. In dollar terms, excluding the 
trading
activities of the PMI Group and MGAS, total export sales decreased by 3.6%, from
U.S. $27.7 billion in the first six months of 2011 to U.S. $26.7 billion in the 
first six months of 2012, due to the depreciation of the peso against the 
dollar.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Crude oil and condensate export 
sales accounted for 88.6% of export sales (excluding the trading activities of 
the PMI Group)
in the first six months of 2012, as compared to 88.1% in the first six months of
2011. Crude oil and condensate export sales increased in peso terms by 7.7%, 
from Ps. 290.7 billion in the first six months of 2011 to Ps. 313.1 billion in 
the first
six months of 2012, primarily due to a 6.4% increase in the weighted average 
export price of the Mexican crude oil basket, from U.S. $99.24 per barrel in the
first six months of 2011 to U.S. $105.60 in the first six months of 2012. The 
volume of
crude oil exports decreased by 9.7%, from 1,355&nbsp;thousand barrels per day in
the first six months of 2011 to 1,224&nbsp;thousand barrels per day in the first
six months of 2012. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Export sales of petroleum products represented 
10.8% of export sales (excluding the trading activities of the PMI Group) in the
first six
months of 2012, as compared to 11.4% in the first six months of 2011. Export 
sales of petroleum products increased by 1.6%, from Ps. 37.5 billion in the 
first six months of 2011 to Ps. 38.1 billion in the first six months of 2012, 
primarily due to
increases in the average export prices and the volume of petroleum product 
exports, such as export fuel oil and naphtha. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">7 </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Export sales of natural gas represented 0.03% 
of total export sales (excluding the trading
activities of MGAS) in the first six months of 2012 and the first six months of 
2011, was not significative. Export sales of natural gas increased by 842.9%, 
from Ps.&nbsp;10.5&nbsp;million in the first six months of 2011 to Ps. 
99.0&nbsp;million in
the first six months of 2012, due primarily to an increase in the volume of 
exports. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Petrochemical 
products accounted for the
remainder of export sales (excluding the trading activities of the PMI Group) in
the first six months of 2011 and 2012 (0.5% and 0.6%, respectively). Export
sales of petrochemical products (including certain by-products of the 
petrochemical process)
increased by 17.6% from Ps. 1.7 billion in the first six months of 2011 to Ps. 
2.0 billion in the first six months of 2012, due to an increase in the volume of
exports of certain petrochemical products, such as ammonia, butadiene and 
ethylene.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Services Income </I></FONT></P> 
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Services income increased by 25.0% 
in the first six months of 2012, from Ps. 2.8 billion in the first six months of
2011 to Ps.&nbsp;3.5&nbsp;billion in the first six months of 2012, mainly as a 
result of
an increase in the amount of freight services provided to third parties. 
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Costs of Sales </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Costs of sales increased by 11.2%, from Ps. 
355.7 billion in the first six months of 2011 to Ps. 395.4 billion in the first 
six months of
2012. This increase was primarily due to (i)&nbsp;an increase in the cost of 
products imported by PEMEX for resale in Mexico or for use in its operations 
because of higher prices, primarily gasoline, and fuel oil, (ii)&nbsp;an 
increase in the cost
of materials and services payable to third parties; (iii)&nbsp;an increase in 
depreciation and amortization because of higher investments of fixed assets 
including wells; and (iv)&nbsp;greater expenditures for exploration and drilling
costs.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Total General Expenses 
</I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Total general expenses increased by
36.9%, from Ps. 40.9 billion in the first six months of 2011 to Ps. 56.0 billion
in the first six months of 2012. This increase was primarily due to the net cost
of
employee benefits as a result of salary increases, the financial impact of an 
additional year of seniority for all employees and changes to the assumptions of
the actuarial calculation. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Other Revenues, Net </I></FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Other revenues, net, increased by 
Ps. 39.2 billion, or 50.3%, from net revenues of Ps. 77.9 billion in the first 
six months of 2011 to net revenues of Ps. 117.1 billion in the first six months 
of 2012,
primarily due to a larger IEPS tax credit, which totaled 
Ps.&nbsp;119.6&nbsp;billion in the first six months of 2012 as compared to Ps. 
80.9 billion in the first six months of 2011. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Comprehensive Financing Result 
</I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Comprehensive financing result 
reflects interest income (including gains and losses on certain derivative 
instruments), interest expense and foreign exchange gain or loss. A substantial 
portion of our
indebtedness, 83.8% as of June&nbsp;30, 2012, is denominated in U.S. dollars and
other foreign currencies, so an appreciation of the Mexican peso against the 
U.S. dollar results in a foreign exchange profit. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our income associated with comprehensive 
financing result decreased by Ps. 19.1 billion, from a gain of Ps. 9.3 billion 
in the first six
months of 2011 to a loss of Ps. 9.8 billion in the first six months of 2012. The
decrease was primarily due to a Ps. 23.6 billion increase in our net interest 
expense (including the expense associated with financial products) from the 
first six
months of 2011 to the first six months of 2012, primarily as a result of greater
losses on derivative financial instruments in the first six months of 2012 as 
compared to the first six months of 2011. This was offset by a Ps. 4.5 billion 
increase in
our net foreign currency exchange gain, which amounted to Ps. 16.8 billion in 
the first six months of 2012, as contrasted with a net gain of Ps. 12.3 billion 
in the first six months of 2011, due to the greater appreciation of the Mexican 
peso
against the Euro during the first six months of 2012 as compared to the first 
six months of 2011. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8 </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Taxes and Duties </I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Hydrocarbon extraction duties and other duties 
and taxes paid increased by 11.0%, from Ps. 419.3 billion in the first six 
months of 2011
to Ps. 465.3 billion in the first six months of 2012, largely due to a 6.4% 
increase in the weighted average price of the Mexican crude oil basket, from 
U.S. $99.24 per barrel in the first six months of 2011 to U.S. $105.60 per 
barrel in the same
period of 2012. Taxes and duties represented 56.9% of total revenues from sales 
and services in the first six months of 2012, as compared to 56.2% in the first 
six months of 2011, because PEMEX&#146;s effective rate of taxes and duties 
increases as
oil prices increase. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; 
margin-left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Net Income
</I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In the first six months of 2012, we
reported a net income of Ps. 8.0 billion (U.S. $0.6 billion) on Ps. 817.4 
billion in total revenues, as compared to a net income of Ps. 17.6 billion (U.S.
$1.3 billion)
on Ps. 746.0 billion in total revenues in the first six months of 2011. This 
decrease in net income is primarily explained by the increase in our cost of 
sales as a result of higher petroleum product prices and volumes, as well as the
decrease in
comprehensive financing result due to greater losses on derivative financial 
instruments and an increase in our taxes and duties. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Liquidity and Capital Resources</B> </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Cash Flows from Operating, 
Financing and Investing Activities </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">During the
first six months of 2012, net funds provided by operating activities, totaled 
Ps. 105.4 billion, as compared to Ps.&nbsp;65.6&nbsp;billion in the first six 
months of 2011. Net income before taxes and duties totaled Ps. 473.2 billion in 
the first six
months of 2012, as compared to net income before taxes and duties of Ps. 436.9 
billion in the first six months of 2011. Our net cash flows from financing
activities were negative Ps. 11.6 billion in the first six months of 2012, as 
compared to
negative Ps. 32.8 billion in the first six months of 2011. During the first six 
months of 2012, we applied net funds of Ps. 80.1 billion to net investments in 
fixed assets, as compared to our application of net funds of Ps. 61.4 billion to
net
investments in fixed assets in the first six months of 2011. </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">At June&nbsp;30, 2012, our cash and cash 
equivalents totaled Ps.
125.8 billion, as compared to Ps. 114.4 billion at December&nbsp;31, 2011. 
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Recent Financing Activities 
</I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">During the period from June&nbsp;16, 2012 to 
August&nbsp;22, 2012, Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos participated in the following 
financings:
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">On June&nbsp;26, 2012, Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos issued 
U.S. $1,750,000,000 of its 5.50% Bonds due 2044. The bonds were issued under 
Petr&oacute;leos
Mexicanos&#146; U.S. $22,000,000,000 Medium-Term Notes Program, Series C. All 
debt securities issued under this program are guaranteed by Pemex-Exploration 
and Production, Pemex-Refining and Pemex-Gas and Basic Petrochemicals.
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-
bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">On July&nbsp;6, 2012, Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos issued two 
series of notes in the amount of U.S. $400,000,000 each, which bear interest at 
a
semi-annual fixed rate of 2.0% and 1.95%, respectively, and mature in December 
2022. The notes are guaranteed by Export-Import Bank of the United States. 
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">On July&nbsp;18, 2012, Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos obtained a
bilateral export credit agency loan for U.S. $300,000,000, which bears interest 
at a fixed
rate of 1.5% annually and matures in July 2017. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0"
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">On July&nbsp;26, 2012, Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos issued 
U.S. $400,000,000 of notes maturing December 2022, which bear interest at a 
semi-annual fixed
rate of 1.70%. The notes are guaranteed by Export-Import Bank of the United 
States. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-
top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">In July 2012, P.M.I. Trading Ltd. obtained and repaid U.S. 
$40,000,000 from its revolving credit line. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">Between June&nbsp;12, 2012 and August&nbsp;14, 2012, P.M.I. 
Holdings B.V. obtained U.S. $2,445,000,000 from its revolving credit line and 
repaid U.S.
$1,675,000,000. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">9 </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Indebtedness </I></FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">During the first six months of 
2012, our total debt decreased by 1.4%, from Ps. 783.2 billion at 
December&nbsp;31, 2011 to Ps.&nbsp;772.1&nbsp;billion at June&nbsp;30, 2012, 
primarily as a result of a
2.4% appreciation of the Mexican peso against the U.S. dollar, as well as from 
an 8.3% decrease in short-term debt. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">At
June&nbsp;30, 2012 and as of the date of this report, we were not in default on 
any of our financing agreements. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-
bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Business 
Overview
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-
left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Production 
</I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New
Roman" SIZE="2">Set forth below are selected summary operating data relating to 
PEMEX. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-
bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff">
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:3.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Maya</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman"

<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff">
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Monthly average West Texas 
Intermediate crude oil average price per barrel</I></FONT><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP STYLE="vertical-
align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(6)</SUP></FONT><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">U.S.
$</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2"> 98.39</FONT></TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">U.S.
$</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2"> 98.16</FONT></TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="line-height:8px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-
bottom:0.5pt solid #000000;width:10%">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="1">Notes:</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="1">Numbers may not total due to rounding. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="1">tbpd =
thousands of barrels per day </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-
bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">mmcfpd = millions
of cubic feet per day </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-
bottom:0px"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1">mt = thousands of tons </FONT></P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="1">(1)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="1">Excludes ethane and butane gases. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="1">(2)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="1">The volume and value of crude oil exports reflects customary 
adjustments by PMI to reflect the percentage of water in each shipment as of 
July&nbsp;9, 2012.
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="1">(3)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="1">Subject to adjustment to reflect the percentage of water in each 
shipment. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="1">(4)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="1">Average price during period indicated based on billed amounts. 
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="1">(5)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="1">On August&nbsp;22, 2012, the weighted average price of PEMEX&#146;s 
crude oil export mix was U.S. $104.37 per barrel. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0"
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="1">(6)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="1">On August&nbsp;22, 2012, the West Texas Intermediate crude oil spot 
price was U.S. $97.04 per barrel. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="1"><I>Source: Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos and PMI. </I></FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">10 </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Crude oil production decreased by 1.1% in the 
first six months of 2012, from
2,565&nbsp;thousand barrels per day in the first quarter of 2011 to 
2,538&nbsp;thousand barrels per day in the first six months of 2012, primarily 
due to: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-
bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">a fire at the Ku-S Processing Center, in the Ku-Maloob-Zaap 
business unit, which caused delays in production; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">a decrease in production of heavy crude oil due to a natural
decline in production of fields in the Cantarell business unit, as well as 
delays in the
completion of wells in the same business unit, due to delays in the contracting 
of drilling equipment, as a result of longer tender processes and changes in 
current market conditions; and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">a decrease in production of extra-light crude oil, primarily
due to a natural decline in production at the Delta del Grijalva and Crudo 
Ligero Marino
projects in the Southern region and Southwestern Marine region, respectively.
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">These decreases 
were
partially offset by production increases in the Yaxch&eacute;, Och-Uech-Kax, 
Chuc, Ogarrio Magallanes and ATG projects. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Natural gas production decreased by 5.4% in the
first six months of 2012, from 6,762&nbsp;million cubic feet per day in the 
first six
months of 2011 to 6,399&nbsp;million cubic feet per day in the first six months 
of 2012. This decrease was primarily the result of: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-
size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">natural declines in production of associated gas at the 
Abkat&uacute;n-Pol Chuc business unit in the Southwestern Marine region, at the 
Samaria Luna
business unit in the Southern region and at the Cantarell business unit in the 
Northeastern Marine region; and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-
size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">a decrease in non-associated gas production due to a planned
reduction in drilling activities and the completion of wells in the Burgos and 
Veracruz
business units of the Northern region. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">These decreases were partially offset by an 
increase in associated
gas production at the Litoral de Tabasco business unit in the Southwestern 
Marine region and at the ATG business unit in the Northern region. </FONT></P> 
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Production of petroleum products 
increased by 3.4% in the first six months of 2012, from 1,385&nbsp;thousand 
barrels per day in the first six months of 2011 to 1,432 barrels per day in the 
first six
months of 2012. This increase was primarily due to an increase in crude oil 
processing since the new plants at the Minatitl&aacute;n refinery came into 
operation. The largest increase recorded was for gasolines and diesel. 
</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Petrochemicals production decreased by 24.6% in
the first six months of 2012, from 4,449&nbsp;thousand tons in the first six 
months of
2011 to 3,355&nbsp;thousand tons in the first six months of 2012. This decrease 
was primarily due to a temporary shutdown in the aromatics chain as a result of 
the incorporation of a new continuous catalytic regeneration (CCR) platforming 
plant in
the Cangrejera Petrochemical Complex, and was partially offset by the following:
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">an increase in production in the methane derivatives chain, 
primarily of ammonia; and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="1%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">an increase in production in the ethane derivatives chain, 
mainly of ethylene and vinyl chloride. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Directors, Senior Management and Employees </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Pursuant to the collective 
bargaining agreement entered into by Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos and the 
<I>Sindicato de Trabajadores Petroleros de la Rep&uacute;blica Mexicana</I> 
(Petroleum Workers&#146;
Union of the Mexican Republic, or the Union) on July&nbsp;27, 2011, 
Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos and the Union agreed to a 4.25% increase in wages and
a 1.5% increase in other benefits on July&nbsp;31, 2012, which became effective 
August&nbsp;1, 2012.
</FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">11 </FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-

family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(Figures stated in thousands of Mexican

<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>PETR&Oacute;LEOS MEXICANOS, SUBSIDIARY 
ENTITIES AND SUBSIDIARY COMPANIES </B></FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="fin402305_5"></A>NOTES TO THE 
UNAUDITED CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>INTERIM FINANCIAL STATEMENTS </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>AS OF JUNE 30, 2012, DECEMBER 
31, 2011 AND JANUARY 1, 2011 AND </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>FOR THE
THREE- AND SIX-MONTH PERIODS ENDED JUNE 30, 2012 AND 2011 </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(Figures stated in thousands of Mexican 
pesos (Note 2))
</B></FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>NOTE 1&#151;STRUCTURE AND BUSINESS OPERATIONS OF 
PETR&Oacute;LEOS MEXICANOS, SUBSIDIARY ENTITIES AND SUBSIDIARY COMPANIES:
</B></FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos was created on 
June&nbsp;7, 1938, and began operations on July&nbsp;20, 1938 in accordance
with a decree of the Mexican Congress stating that all foreign-owned oil 
companies in operation at that time in the United Mexican States 
(&#147;Mexico&#148;) were thereby nationalized. Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos and 
its four Subsidiary Entities are
decentralized public entities of the Federal Government of Mexico (the 
&#147;Mexican Government&#148;) and together comprise the Mexican oil and gas 
industry. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The operations of Petr&oacute;leos 
Mexicanos and its Subsidiary Entities are regulated mainly by the 
Constituci&oacute;n Pol&iacute;tica de los Estados Unidos Mexicanos (Political 
Constitution of the
United Mexican States, or the &#147;Mexican Constitution&#148;), the Ley 
Reglamentaria del Art&iacute;culo 27 Constitucional en el Ramo del 
Petr&oacute;leo (Regulatory Law to Article 27 of the Political Constitution of 
the United Mexican States
concerning Petroleum Affairs, or the &#147;Regulatory Law&#148;), and the Ley de
Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos (Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos Law) and the Reglamento 
de la Ley de Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos (Regulations to the Petr&oacute;leos 
Mexicanos
Law), which establishes the State will be exclusively entrusted with the 
activities in the strategic areas of petroleum, hydrocarbons and basic 
petrochemicals through Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos and its Subsidiary Entities, 
with Petr&oacute;leos
Mexicanos (Corporate) responsible for the central conduction and strategic 
direction of such activities. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-
bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">The Petr&oacute;leos
Mexicanos Law, which was published in the Diario Oficial de la Federaci&oacute;n
(Official Gazette of the Federation) on November&nbsp;28, 2008, establishes that
the four Subsidiary Entities, as created by the Ley Org&aacute;nica de 
Petr&oacute;leos
Mexicanos y Organismos Subsidiarios (Organic Law of Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos 
and the Subsidiary Entities), which preceded the Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos Law,
will continue carrying out their activities in accordance with their objectives,
fulfilling the commitments they have already assumed in Mexico and abroad, 
unless and until the Mexican Government issues a decree or decrees of 
reorganization based on a proposal by the Board. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Subsidiary Entities are decentralized 
public entities of a technical, industrial and commercial nature with their own 
corporate
identity and equity and with the legal authority to own property and conduct 
business in their own names. The Subsidiary Entities are controlled by and have 
the characteristics of subsidiaries of Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos. The 
Subsidiary Entities
are: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-
bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">Pemex-Exploraci&oacute;n y Producci&oacute;n (&#147;Pemex-
Exploration and Production&#148;); </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">Pemex-Refinaci&oacute;n (&#147;Pemex-Refining&#148;); 
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">Pemex-Gas y Petroqu&iacute;mica B&aacute;sica (&#147;Pemex-
Gas and Basic Petrochemicals&#148;); and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times 
New Roman" SIZE="2">Pemex-Petroqu&iacute;mica (&#147;Pemex-
Petrochemicals&#148;). </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">F-7
</FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>PETR&Oacute;LEOS MEXICANOS, SUBSIDIARY 
ENTITIES AND SUBSIDIARY COMPANIES
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>NOTES TO THE UNAUDITED CONDENSED
CONSOLIDATED </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>INTERIM FINANCIAL STATEMENTS </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>AS OF JUNE 30, 2012, DECEMBER 
31, 2011 AND JANUARY 1, 2011 AND </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>FOR THE
THREE- AND SIX-MONTH PERIODS ENDED JUNE 30, 2012 AND 2011 </B></FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(Figures stated in thousands of Mexican 
pesos (Note 2))
</B></FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT 
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The strategic activities entrusted to 
Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos and the Subsidiary
Entities can be performed only by Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos and these Entities.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The principal objectives of the 
Subsidiary
Entities are as follows: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-
top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">I.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">Pemex-Exploration and Production explores for and produces crude oil 
and natural gas; additionally, this entity transports, stores and markets such 
products;
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-
bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">II.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">Pemex-Refining refines petroleum products and derivatives thereof that 
may be used as basic industrial raw materials; additionally, this entity stores,
transports,
distributes and markets such products and derivatives; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">III.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">Pemex-Gas and Basic Petrochemicals processes natural gas, natural gas 
liquids and derivatives thereof that may be used as basic industrial raw 
materials, and stores,
transports, distributes and markets such products; additionally, this entity 
stores, transports, distributes and markets basic petrochemicals; and 
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-
bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" 
CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">IV.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">Pemex-Petrochemicals engages in industrial petrochemical processing and
stores, distributes and markets secondary petrochemicals. 
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For purposes of these condensed consolidated 
interim financial statements, any capitalized name or term that is not defined
herein, will
have the meaning attributed to it in the Regulatory Law or in the 
Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos Law. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-
bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">The principal distinction
between the Subsidiary Entities and the Subsidiary Companies (as defined below) 
is that the Subsidiary Entities are decentralized public entities created by the
predecessor statute to the Organic Law of Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos, whereas 
the
Subsidiary Companies are companies that have been formed in accordance with the 
applicable laws of each of the respective jurisdictions in which they have been 
incorporated, and are managed as private corporations. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">PEMEX&#146;s address and its principal place of
business is: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-
left:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Av. Marina Nacional No.&nbsp;329 
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Col. Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos 
</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">M&eacute;xico, D.F. 11311 </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">M&eacute;xico </FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>AS OF JUNE 30, 2012, DECEMBER 
31, 2011 AND JANUARY 1, 2011 AND </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>FOR THE
THREE- AND SIX-MONTH PERIODS ENDED JUNE 30, 2012 AND 2011 </B></FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(Figures stated in thousands of Mexican 
pesos (Note 2))
</B></FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT 
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>NOTE 2&#151;BASIS OF PREPARATION: </B></FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(a) Statement of compliance </B></FONT></P> 
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">These unaudited condensed 
consolidated interim financial statements have been prepared in accordance with 
International Accounting Standard 34 &#147;Interim Financial Reporting&#148; 
(&#147;IAS 34&#148;)
issued by the International Accounting Standard Board (&#147;IASB&#148;). These 
unaudited condensed consolidated interim financial statements do not include all
the information and disclosure required for full annual consolidated financial
statements, and should be read in conjunction with PEMEX&#146;s audited 
consolidated financial statements as of and for the year ended December 31, 
2011, which were prepared under Mexican Financial Reporting Standards 
(&#147;Mexican FRS&#148;).
PEMEX estimates that there is no significant impact on its unaudited condensed 
consolidated interim financial statements, due to the seasonality of operations.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On August&nbsp;23, 2012, these 
unaudited condensed consolidated interim financial statements and the notes 
thereto were authorized for issuance by the following officers: Public 
Accountant V&iacute;ctor
M. C&aacute;mara Pe&oacute;n, Deputy Director of Accounting, Fiscal and 
Financial Controls and C. Francisco J. Torres Su&aacute;rez, Associate Managing 
Director of Accounting. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px;
margin-left:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(b) Adoption of International 
Financial Reporting Standards as issued by the International Accounting 
Standards Board </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; 
text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Until December&nbsp;31, 2011, 
PEMEX&#146;s condensed consolidated interim financial statements were prepared 
under Mexican FRS. Beginning January&nbsp;1, 2012, the condensed consolidated 
interim financial
statements are prepared under IFRS as issued by the IASB. </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">PEMEX established January&nbsp;1, 2011 as the 
&#147;transition
date&#148; to IFRS. The rules for first-time adopters of IFRS are established in
IFRS 1 &#147;First-time Adoption of International Financial Reporting 
Standards&#148; (&#147;IFRS&nbsp;1&#148;). </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The statements of financial position as of 
December&nbsp;31 and January&nbsp;1, 2011, as well as the statements of 
comprehensive income,
statements of changes in equity and statements of cash flows for the six-month 
period ended June&nbsp;30, 2011, and the statements of comprehensive income for 
the three-month period ended June&nbsp;30, 2011 are included solely for 
comparative
purposes and were prepared in accordance with IFRS, using the same accounting 
policies and procedures used in the preparation of the condensed consolidated 
financial statements as of and for the six-month period ended June&nbsp;30, 2012
and the
statements of comprehensive income for the three-month period ended 
June&nbsp;30, 2012. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">F-9
</FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>PETR&Oacute;LEOS MEXICANOS, SUBSIDIARY 
ENTITIES AND SUBSIDIARY COMPANIES
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>NOTES TO THE UNAUDITED CONDENSED
CONSOLIDATED </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>INTERIM FINANCIAL STATEMENTS </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>AS OF JUNE 30, 2012, DECEMBER 
31, 2011 AND JANUARY 1, 2011 AND </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>FOR THE
THREE- AND SIX-MONTH PERIODS ENDED JUNE 30, 2012 AND 2011 </B></FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(Figures stated in thousands of Mexican 
pesos (Note 2))
</B></FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT 
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In order to determine its opening statement of 
financial position and comparative
adoption statement of financial position as required by IFRS 1, PEMEX in 
accordance with IFRS 1, chose the following exemptions and exceptions: 
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i) Optional Exemptions Under IFRS 
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Exemption to use fair value as 
deemed cost
for well, pipelines, plant and equipment items </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">IFRS 1 provides the option to measure property, plant and 
equipment, as
well as certain intangibles, at their fair value as of the date of transition to
IFRS and use that fair value as the deemed cost of the relevant assets, or to 
use the updated book value previously reported under Mexican FRS, provided that 
such book
value is broadly comparable to (a)&nbsp;fair value; or (b)&nbsp;cost or 
depreciated cost under IFRS, adjusted to recognize changes in inflation. 
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">PEMEX has chosen to value certain 
of its plants, pipelines, offshore platforms and drilling equipment at fair 
value as of the transition date, and, in addition, to subject these fixed assets
to impairment
tests. For the remaining fixed assets, PEMEX has chosen to use their current 
values under Mexican FRS as their deemed cost. The net effect of the change in 
valuation of fixed assets is recognized against the initial balance of 
(accumulated losses)
retained earnings under IFRS as of the transition date. </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Exemption for borrowing costs 
</I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">IFRS 1 allows entities to apply the 
transitional guidelines included in revised IAS 23 &#147;Borrowing Costs&#148;, 
which provides that
the standard is effective as of January&nbsp;1, 2009 or the transition date to 
IFRS, whichever is later, unless the entity elects retrospective application. 
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">PEMEX chose to apply this exception
and begin to capitalize all financing costs prospectively from the transition 
date. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-
left:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Exemption for accumulated 
currency translation effects </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-
bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">IFRS 1 permits the
cancellation of accumulated gains and losses arising from the translation of 
foreign currency amounts in the consolidation of the financial statements 
related to foreign operations and investments accounted for by the equity method
under Mexican
FRS. This exception allows entities to avoid calculating the accumulated foreign
currency translation effect in accordance with IAS 21, &#147;The Effects of 
Changes in Foreign Exchange Rates&#148;, as of the date on which the subsidiary 
or
investment accounted for by the equity method was created or acquired. Instead, 
PEMEX has chosen to cancel the accumulated gains and losses from foreign 
currency translation effect against the initial balance of (accumulated losses) 
retained
earnings under IFRS as of the transition date. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Exemption for determining cost in the measurement of 
investment in
subsidiaries and associates in the preparation of separate financial 
statements</I> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">When an entity 
prepares separate financial
statements, IAS 27 &#147;Consolidated and Separate Financial Statements&#148; 
(&#147;IAS 27&#148;) requires accounting for investments in subsidiaries, 
jointly controlled entities and associates at cost or fair value according to 
IFRS 9
</FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">F-10
</FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>PETR&Oacute;LEOS MEXICANOS, SUBSIDIARY 
ENTITIES AND SUBSIDIARY COMPANIES
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>NOTES TO THE UNAUDITED CONDENSED
CONSOLIDATED </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>INTERIM FINANCIAL STATEMENTS </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>AS OF JUNE 30, 2012, DECEMBER 
31, 2011 AND JANUARY 1, 2011 AND </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>FOR THE
THREE- AND SIX-MONTH PERIODS ENDED JUNE 30, 2012 AND 2011 </B></FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(Figures stated in thousands of Mexican 
pesos (Note 2))
</B></FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT 
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">
&#147;Financial Instruments&#148;. IFRS 1 allows investments to be measured by 
one of the following methods: a) the cost determined in accordance with IAS 27, 
or b) the deemed cost. The deemed
cost of the investment will be: i) the fair value determined according to IFRS 
9, or ii) the carrying amount under previous GAAP, at the transition date. 
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In accordance with IAS 27, PEMEX 
chose to use the carrying amount under Mexican FRS as the transition date as the
deemed cost of its investments in the preparation of separate financial 
statements.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(ii) Mandatory exceptions under 
IFRS 1 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-
left:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Exception for accounting 
estimates </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Estimates prepared
under IFRS as of the
transition date should coincide with those previously prepared under the 
entity&#146;s former accounting principles basis, unless there is objective 
evidence that the previous estimates contained factual errors as of their dates.
PEMEX has reviewed
its estimates under Mexican FRS as of the transition date and has made no 
changes to the previously determined estimates. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:2%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iii) Other policy changes </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Early adoption of IAS 19 
(revised) &#147;Employee Benefits&#148; (&#147;IAS 19&#148;) </I></FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">PEMEX chose the early adoption of 
IAS 19, which eliminates the use of the &#147;corridor method&#148; to recognize
actuarial gains and losses. As a result, such items are now recognized in other
comprehensive income (loss) in the period in which they are incurred. Items that
may be recognized in the statement of comprehensive income are limited to past 
and present service costs, gains or losses arising from plan curtailments or 
settlements
and interest income or expense. All other gains or losses in (liabilities) 
assets for termination or retirement benefits are recognized in other 
comprehensive income (loss), with no further impact on the results of 
operations. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As a result, PEMEX has recognized all 
unamortized actuarial gains or losses and plan modifications reported under 
Mexican FRS against the
initial balance of (accumulated losses) retained earnings under IFRS. 
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Additionally, accruals for 
termination benefits are
only recognized when an entity has incurred a legal obligation to pay such 
benefits to the employee. For this reason, as of the transition date, PEMEX has 
cancelled the component of termination benefits against the initial balance of 
(accumulated
losses) retained earnings under IFRS. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">F-11
</FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
