SIZE="1">219,521,157</FONT></TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">F-32
</FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>PETR&Oacute;LEOS MEXICANOS, SUBSIDIARY 
ENTITIES AND SUBSIDIARY COMPANIES
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>NOTES TO THE UNAUDITED CONDENSED
CONSOLIDATED </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>INTERIM FINANCIAL STATEMENTS </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>AS OF JUNE 30, 2012, DECEMBER 
31, 2011 AND JANUARY 1, 2011 AND </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>FOR THE
THREE- AND SIX-MONTH PERIODS ENDED JUNE 30, 2012 AND 2011 </B></FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(Figures stated in thousands of Mexican 
pesos (Note 2))
</B></FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT 
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>NOTE 11&#151;CONTINGENCIES </B></FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">PEMEX is involved in various civil, tax, 
criminal, administrative, labor and commercial lawsuits and arbitration
proceedings. The results of these proceedings are uncertain as of this date. As 
of June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2012, PEMEX had accrued a reserve of Ps. 9,510,573, for 
these contingent liabilities. The current status of the principal lawsuits in 
which PEMEX
is involved is as follows: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-
bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">In September 2001, Conproca, S.A. de C.V. (&#147;CONPROCA&#148;), the 
construction company
performing construction and maintenance services for Pemex-Refining&#146;s 
Cadereyta refinery, filed a claim for arbitration before the International Court
of Arbitration of the International Chamber of Commerce (the &#147;ICA&#148;) 
against
Pemex-Refining and Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos (No.&nbsp;11760/KGA) related to 
expenses incurred by CONPROCA for, among other things, additional work performed
and value added. On December&nbsp;17, 2008, the ICA issued a general liability 
award in
favor of CONPROCA, without specifying an amount to be paid by Pemex-Refining or 
Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos. CONPROCA is seeking a total amount of U.S.&nbsp;
$424,890 and Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos and Pemex-Refining are seeking 
U.S.&nbsp;$116,025. On
January&nbsp;11, 2012, the ICA notified the parties of the final award, pursuant
to which Pemex-Refining and Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos were ordered to pay 
U.S.&nbsp;$311,178 and CONPROCA was ordered to pay U.S.&nbsp;$29,056. After the 
amounts were
offset, the amount to be paid to CONPROCA is U.S.&nbsp;$282,121 plus financial 
expenses and taxes. On February&nbsp;10, 2012, CONPROCA filed a request to 
clarify the final amount of the award, which was denied and notified to the 
parties on
April&nbsp;30, 2012. On December&nbsp;14, 2011, CONPROCA filed a claim before 
the ICA, which was notified to the parties on April&nbsp;13, 2012, seeking 
recognition of the general liability award issued on December&nbsp;17, 2008. 
Subsequently,
CONPROCA widened the scope of this claim in two separate filings. As of the date
of this report, the response of Pemex-Refining and Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos to
this claim is still pending. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In December 2003, Uni&oacute;n de Sistemas 
Industriales, S.A. de C.V. (&#147;USISA&#148;) filed a claim (No. 202/2003) 
before the
<I>Juzgado Tercero de Distrito en Materia Civil</I> (Third Civil District Court)
in the Federal District against Pemex-Refining, seeking to nullify a fixed-price
work contract with a predetermined length, whose object was the modernization of
the
cathodic protection system in certain Pemex-Refining pipelines, and seeking 
approximately Ps.&nbsp;393,094 in damages and expenses. On July&nbsp;13, 2010, 
the <I>Segundo Tribunal Unitario en Materias Civil y Administrativa del Primer 
Circuito</I>
(Second Unit Civil and Administrative Court of the First Circuit) in the Federal
District issued a judgment in connection with an <I>amparo</I> filed by USISA, 
ordering Pemex-Refining to pay Ps.&nbsp;89,000 plus the plaintiff&#146;s 
financial
expenses. On March&nbsp;22, 2011, Pemex-Refining paid the principal portion of 
the judgment. Subsequently, the plaintiff filed a motion for the payment of 
financial expenses seeking approximately Ps. 67,281, to which Pemex-Refining
responded. The
evidentiary stage related to this payment was opened, and Pemex-Refining 
appointed its expert, who accepted his designation. On May&nbsp;11, 2012, a 
final hearing was held and the evidentiary stage was concluded. As of this date,
a final resolution
is still pending. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">F-33
</FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>PETR&Oacute;LEOS MEXICANOS, SUBSIDIARY 
ENTITIES AND SUBSIDIARY COMPANIES
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>NOTES TO THE UNAUDITED CONDENSED
CONSOLIDATED </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>INTERIM FINANCIAL STATEMENTS </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>AS OF JUNE 30, 2012, DECEMBER 
31, 2011 AND JANUARY 1, 2011 AND </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>FOR THE
THREE- AND SIX-MONTH PERIODS ENDED JUNE 30, 2012 AND 2011 </B></FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(Figures stated in thousands of Mexican 
pesos (Note 2))
</B></FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT 
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In December 2004, Corporaci&oacute;n Mexicana 
de Mantenimiento Integral, S. de R.L. de
C.V. (&#147;COMMISA&#148;) filed an arbitration claim (No. 13613/CCO/JRF) before
the ICA against Pemex-Exploration and Production for, among other things, a 
breach of a construction agreement in connection with two platforms in the 
Cantarell project
(Project No. IPC-01). On January&nbsp;13, 2010, the ICA notified Pemex-
Exploration and Production that it had issued an award, dated December&nbsp;16, 
2009, requiring Pemex-Exploration and Production to pay COMMISA sums of 
approximately
U.S.&nbsp;$293,645 and Ps.&nbsp;34,459, plus interest, but also requiring 
COMMISA to pay Pemex-Exploration and Production a sum of approximately 
U.S.&nbsp;$5,919, plus interest. On January&nbsp;11, 2010, Pemex-Exploration and
Production was notified
that COMMISA had filed a motion (No. 10-cv-00206-AKH) before the U.S. District 
Court for the Southern District of New York requesting the enforcement of the 
ICA award in its favor. On November&nbsp;2, 2010 a judgment was issued and 
Pemex-Exploration
and Production was ordered to pay U.S.&nbsp;$355,864. On November&nbsp;15, 2010,
Pemex-Exploration and Production appealed the ruling and requested that 
execution of the judgment be postponed until the appeal is resolved. This 
request was granted,
on the condition that Pemex-Exploration and Production deposit U.S. $395,009 in 
an account of the Court. Such amount was deposited by Pemex-Exploration and 
Production in the Court&#146;s account on December&nbsp;30, 2010. Previously,
Pemex-Exploration and Production had filed a motion before the <I>Juzgado Quinto
de Distrito en Materia Civil</I> (Fifth Civil District Court) in the Federal
District, requesting that the award be declared null and void, which was granted
on
October&nbsp;24, 2011. Based on this resolution, Pemex-Exploration and 
Production filed a motion before the U.S. District Court and the Second Circuit 
Court of Appeals requesting that the judgment against Pemex-Exploration and 
Production be declared
void, that the guarantee deposit be returned to Pemex-Exploration and Production
and that the COMMISA request for enforcement be rejected. A hearing in 
connection with the appeal was held on February&nbsp;2, 2012. On 
February&nbsp;16, 2012, the
Second Circuit Court of Appeals vacated the District Court&#146;s judgment and 
remanded the case to the District Court for reconsideration in light of the 
intervening decision of the Mexican court. COMMISA has requested that the 
arbitration award be
confirmed. A hearing was held on May&nbsp;10, 2012. As a result of this hearing,
the parties will file briefs related to the recognition of the judgment issued 
by the Mexican court. A second hearing was held on July&nbsp;12, 2012, at which 
the
deadline for filing the briefs related to the recognition of the judgment by the
Mexican court was extended. A new hearing will be held on September&nbsp;5, 
2012. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In February 2010, the <I>Servicio 
de Administraci&oacute;n Tributaria</I> (the Tax Management Service) notified 
Pemex-Exploration and Production of the results of its review of Pemex-
Exploration and
Production&#146;s financial statements for the fiscal year ended 
December&nbsp;31, 2006 with respect to federal taxes, value added tax and 
Ordinary Duty on Hydrocarbons payable by it. On September&nbsp;20, 2010, the Tax
Management Service determined
that Pemex-Exploration and Production owed additional taxes totaling 
Ps.&nbsp;4,575,208 (of which Pemex was notified on September&nbsp;22, 2010). On 
November&nbsp;30, 2010, Pemex-Exploration and Production
</FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">F-34
</FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>PETR&Oacute;LEOS MEXICANOS, SUBSIDIARY 
ENTITIES AND SUBSIDIARY COMPANIES
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>NOTES TO THE UNAUDITED CONDENSED
CONSOLIDATED </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>INTERIM FINANCIAL STATEMENTS </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>AS OF JUNE 30, 2012, DECEMBER 
31, 2011 AND JANUARY 1, 2011 AND </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>FOR THE
THREE- AND SIX-MONTH PERIODS ENDED JUNE 30, 2012 AND 2011 </B></FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(Figures stated in thousands of Mexican 
pesos (Note 2))
</B></FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT 
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">
filed an administrative claim (No. 28733/10-17-03-7) before the <I>Tercera Sala 
Regional Metropolitana</I> (Third Regional Metropolitan Court) of the 
<I>Tribunal Federal de Justicia Fiscal y
Administrativa</I> (Tax and Administrative Federal Court) challenging the 
assessment. On February&nbsp;14, 2011, this claim was accepted before the Court.
On August&nbsp;24, 2011, the Tax Management Service filed its response and a 
motion against
the expert evidence offered by Pemex-Exploration and Production. On 
August&nbsp;30, 2011, Pemex-Exploration and Production filed an appeal against 
this motion. On September&nbsp;6, 2011, the expert appointed by Pemex-
Exploration and Production
accepted his designation. As of this date, the trial is in the evidentiary 
stage. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In February 2010, 
the Tax Management
Service notified Pemex-Refining of the results of its review of Pemex-
Refining&#146;s financial statements for the fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31,
2006 with respect to federal contributions, value added tax and the Hydrocarbons
Income Tax. On
September&nbsp;20, 2010, the Tax Management Service notified Pemex-Refining that
it owed approximately Ps.&nbsp;1,553,371 (including penalties and interest). On 
November&nbsp;30, 2010, Pemex-Refining filed an administrative claim
(No.&nbsp;28733/10-17-03-7) before the Third Regional Metropolitan Court of the 
Tax and Administrative Federal Court challenging the assessment. On 
February&nbsp;14, 2011, this claim was accepted before the Court. On 
August&nbsp;24, 2011, the Tax
Management Service filed its response and a motion against the expert evidence 
offered by Pemex-Refining. On August&nbsp;30, 2011, Pemex-Refining filed an 
appeal against this motion. On September&nbsp;6, 2011, the expert appointed by 
Pemex-Refining
accepted his designation. As of this date, the trial is in the evidentiary 
stage. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On April&nbsp;14, 
2010, Petr&oacute;leos
Mexicanos and Pemex-Gas and Basic Petrochemicals were summoned before the 
<I>Juzgado S&eacute;ptimo de Distrito</I> (Seventh District Court) in Reynosa, 
Tamaulipas, in connection with a civil claim filed by Irma Ayala Tijerina de 
Barroso, et al.,
seeking approximately Ps.&nbsp;1,490,873 in damages for the alleged 
contamination of land adjacent to water treatment facilities in the Reynosa Gas 
Processing Complex. On May&nbsp;7, 2010, Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos and Pemex-
Gas and Basic
Petrochemicals filed a response arguing that the court lacked subject matter 
jurisdiction and territorial jurisdiction. In addition, Petr&oacute;leos 
Mexicanos and Pemex-Gas and Basic Petrochemicals filed an interlocutory appeal 
claiming that, while
they had submitted to the jurisdiction of the Federal Courts in Mexico City 
under a related right of access agreement, the Seventh District Court lacked 
territorial jurisdiction to hear this claim. This appeal was denied. 
Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos
and Pemex-Gas and Basic Petrochemicals filed an appeal against this resolution 
before the <I>Tercer Tribunal Unitario del D&eacute;cimo Noveno Circuito</I> 
(Third Unit Court of the Nineteenth Circuit), which was denied on May&nbsp;6, 
2011. On
May&nbsp;26, 2011, the defendants filed an <I>amparo</I> and a provisional 
suspension was granted, but the territorial jurisdiction of the Seventh District
Court in Reynosa, Tamaulipas was subsequently confirmed. On April&nbsp;20, 2012,
the
provisional suspension was lifted and the evidentiary stage was opened, and the 
parties filed their documentary evidence and experts&#146; opinions with the 
Seventh District Court. As of this date, a final resolution is still pending. 
</FONT></P>
<p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">F-35
</FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>PETR&Oacute;LEOS MEXICANOS, SUBSIDIARY 
ENTITIES AND SUBSIDIARY COMPANIES
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>NOTES TO THE UNAUDITED CONDENSED
CONSOLIDATED </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>INTERIM FINANCIAL STATEMENTS </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>AS OF JUNE 30, 2012, DECEMBER 
31, 2011 AND JANUARY 1, 2011 AND </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>FOR THE
THREE- AND SIX-MONTH PERIODS ENDED JUNE 30, 2012 AND 2011 </B></FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(Figures stated in thousands of Mexican 
pesos (Note 2))
</B></FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT 
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In February 2011, EMS Energy Services de 
M&eacute;xico, S. de R.L. de C.V. and Energy
Maintenance Services Group I. LLC filed a claim against Pemex-Exploration and 
Production before the <I>Juzgado Tercero de Distrito</I> (Third District Court) 
in Villahermosa, Tabasco (No. 227/2010). The plaintiffs are seeking, among other
things,
damages totaling U.S.&nbsp;$193,713 related to the termination of a public works
contract and non-payment by Pemex-Exploration and Production under the contract.
As of the date of this report, the trial is in the evidentiary stage. On
December&nbsp;2, 2011, the <I>Segundo Tribunal Unitario del D&eacute;cimo 
Circuito</I> (Second Unit Court of the Tenth Circuit) granted the appeal filed 
by the plaintiffs (No. 31/2011-VII) against a resolution dated August&nbsp;29, 
2011 rejecting
evidence previously filed by the plaintiffs. On January&nbsp;5, 2012, the Third 
District Court requested from the <I>S&eacute;ptima Sala Regional Metropolitana 
del Tribunal Federal de Justicia Fiscal y Administrativa</I> (Seventh 
Metropolitan
Regional Court of the Tax and Administrative Federal Court) additional 
documentary evidence. This request is still pending. On that same date, a 
documentation request filed by the plaintiffs addressed to Pemex-Exploration and
Production was denied.
The plaintiffs filed an appeal against this resolution, which was denied on 
January&nbsp;11, 2012. On January&nbsp;19, 2012, the plaintiffs filed a new 
appeal against this resolution. Subsequently, the financial, economic, 
accounting and engineering
experts filed their opinions with the Third District Court. On March&nbsp;28, 
2012, the Second Unit Court of the Tenth Circuit confirmed the resolution and 
therefore, the appeal was denied. On June&nbsp;25, 2012 the accounting and 
economic experts
appointed by the defendant filed additional information related to their 
opinions. The plaintiffs then filed an <I>amparo</I> (No.&nbsp;2185/2010-II) 
before the <I>Juzgado Cuarto de Distrito </I>(Fourth District Court) in Tabasco,
arguing that the
<I>Ley de Obras P&uacute;blicas y Servicios Relacionados con las Mismas</I> (Law
of Public Works and Related Services) is unconstitutional and the guarantee paid
under the public works contract should be returned to the plaintiffs. On
February&nbsp;16, 2012, the <I>amparo</I> was denied. The plaintiffs filed a 
motion to review this resolution before the Joint Civil and Labor Court of the 
Tenth Circuit, which was admitted. Subsequently, the plaintiffs filed another 
<I>amparo</I>
against the Law of Public Works and Related Services and the guarantee paid 
(No.&nbsp;556/2011-II) before the <I>Juzgado Quinto de Distrito en Materia 
Administrativa</I> (Fifth Administrative District Court) in the Federal 
District, which was denied
on October&nbsp;31, 2011. The plaintiffs filed a motion to review this 
resolution, which was denied on February&nbsp;23, 2012. Therefore, this 
<I>amparo</I> has concluded. The plaintiffs also filed an administrative claim 
(No.&nbsp;4957/11-17-07-1)
before the Seventh Metropolitan Regional Court of the Tax and Administrative 
Federal Court seeking that Pemex-Exploration and Production&#146;s termination 
of the public works contract be declared null and void. Pemex-Exploration and 
Production was
summoned on April&nbsp;4, 2011, and filed its response to the claim on 
June&nbsp;13, 2011. On August&nbsp;24, 2011, Pemex-Exploration and Production 
was notified that their response had been admitted, along with the opinions of 
economic and
financial experts. In addition, the Seventh Metropolitan Regional Court of the 
Tax and Administrative Federal Court requested that Pemex-Exploration and 
Production appoint its experts and provide related documentation, which was 
provided on
September&nbsp;9, 2011. On February&nbsp;7, 2012, the experts appeared before 
the Court. On June&nbsp;28, 2012, the experts&#146; opinions were filed. As of 
this date, a final resolution is still pending. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">F-36
</FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>

<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>PETR&Oacute;LEOS MEXICANOS, SUBSIDIARY 
ENTITIES AND SUBSIDIARY COMPANIES
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>NOTES TO THE UNAUDITED CONDENSED
CONSOLIDATED </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>INTERIM FINANCIAL STATEMENTS </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>AS OF JUNE 30, 2012, DECEMBER 
31, 2011 AND JANUARY 1, 2011 AND </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>FOR THE
THREE- AND SIX-MONTH PERIODS ENDED JUNE 30, 2012 AND 2011 </B></FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(Figures stated in thousands of Mexican 
pesos (Note 2))
</B></FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT 
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On July&nbsp;5, 2011, Pemex-Exploration and 
Production was summoned before the
<I>Juzgado D&eacute;cimo segundo de Distrito en Materia Civil</I> (Twelfth
District Civil Court) in the Federal District in connection with a civil claim 
(No. 469/2010) filed by Saboratto, S.A. de C.V. for, among other things, 
liability and damages
in connection with various services agreements. Saboratto, S.A. de C.V. is 
seeking approximately Ps. 1,451,472 in total damages. On August&nbsp;5, 2011 
Pemex-Exploration and Production filed a response to this claim and a motion 
stating that the
court lacked jurisdiction. This motion was denied on August&nbsp;8, 2011. Pemex-
Exploration and Production filed an appeal against this resolution, which was 
denied. Pemex-Exploration and Production filed an <I>amparo</I> against this 
resolution. A
constitutional hearing was held on January&nbsp;13, 2012, and the <I>amparo</I> 
filed by Pemex-Exploration and Production was denied. Subsequently, Pemex-
Exploration and Production filed a motion to review this resolution. As of the 
date of this
report, a resolution of this motion is still pending. In addition, on 
November&nbsp;14, 2011, the plaintiff filed a motion to suspend the guarantees 
granted in the services agreements, which was denied. The plaintiff filed an 
appeal (No. 508/2011)
before the <I>Tercer Tribunal Unitario en Materia Civil y Administrativa 
</I>(Third Unit Civil and Administrative Court), which was denied. As of the 
date of this report, a final resolution is still pending. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On July&nbsp;8, 2011, Pemex-Exploration and 
Production was summoned in connection with an administrative claim 
(No.&nbsp;4334/11-11-02-6)
filed by Compa&ntilde;&iacute;a Petrolera La Norma, S.A., against the Director 
General of Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos and the Director General of Pemex-
Exploration and Production before the <I>Segunda Sala Regional Hidalgo-
M&eacute;xico</I>
(Hidalgo-Mexico Second Regional Court) of the Tax and Administrative Federal 
Court in Tlalnepantla, State of Mexico. The plaintiff is seeking to have the 
lack of recognition of its alleged petroleum rights concessions declared null 
and void, and is
also seeking damages of approximately Ps. 1,552,730. In November 2011, the trial
was suspended based on a motion filed by Pemex-Exploration and Production and 
Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos arguing that the court lacked jurisdiction. On 
March&nbsp;6,
2012, the Court ruled that it will not admit this motion until the Tax 
Management Service files a report about the plaintiff&#146;s tax residence. As 
of this date, a final resolution is still pending. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The results of these proceedings are uncertain 
until their final resolutions are issued by the appropriate authorities. 
</FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">F-37
</FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>PETR&Oacute;LEOS MEXICANOS, SUBSIDIARY 
ENTITIES AND SUBSIDIARY COMPANIES
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>NOTES TO THE UNAUDITED CONDENSED
CONSOLIDATED </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>INTERIM FINANCIAL STATEMENTS </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>AS OF JUNE 30, 2012, DECEMBER 
31, 2011 AND JANUARY 1, 2011 AND </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>FOR THE
THREE- AND SIX-MONTH PERIODS ENDED JUNE 30, 2012 AND 2011 </B></FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(Figures stated in thousands of Mexican 
pesos (Note 2))
</B></FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT 
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>NOTE 12&#151;SUBSEQUENT EVENTS </B></FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">From July&nbsp;1, 2012 to August&nbsp;23, 2012,
the significant financing activities of PEMEX were as follows:
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On July&nbsp;6, 2012, 
Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos issued two series of notes in the amount of 
U.S.&nbsp;$400,000 each, which
bear interest at a semi-annual fixed rate of 2% and 1.95% respectively, and 
mature in December 2022. The notes are guaranteed by Export-Import Bank of the 
United States. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On July&nbsp;18, 2012, 
Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos obtained a bilateral export credit agency loan for 
U.S. $300,000, which bears interest at a fixed rate of 1.5% annually and matures
in July 2017.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On July&nbsp;26, 2012, 
Petr&oacute;leos Mexicanos issued U.S. $400,000 of notes maturing December 2022,
which bear interest
at a semi-annual fixed rate of 1.70%. The notes are guaranteed by Export-Import 
Bank of the United States. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-
bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">In July 2012,
P.M.I. Trading, Ltd. obtained and repaid U.S. $40,000 from its revolving credit 
line. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Between 
June&nbsp;12, 2012 and
August&nbsp;14, 2012, P.M.I. H.B.V. obtained U.S.&nbsp;$2,445,000 from its 
revolving credit line and repaid U.S. $1,675,000. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">On August&nbsp;23, 2012, the exchange rate was 
13.1762 pesos per U.S. dollar, which represents a 3.5% appreciation of the value
of the
peso in dollar terms as compared to the exchange rate as of June&nbsp;30, 2012, 
which was Ps. 13.6530&nbsp;per dollar. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">On
August&nbsp;23, 2012, the weighted average price of the crude oil exported by 
PEMEX was U.S. $104.49 per barrel, an increase of 15.5% as compared to the 
average price as of June&nbsp;30, 2012, which was U.S. $90.47 per barrel. 
</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As of December&nbsp;31, 2011 and as of 
August&nbsp;23, 2012, PEMEX has valued and recorded the 57,204,240 Repsol shares
acquired by PMI
HBV during 2011 as an available-for-sale investment. The market value of Repsol 
shares has decreased approximately 40.1% from &#128;23.74&nbsp;per share as of 
December&nbsp;30, 2011 to &#128;14.22 per share as of August&nbsp;23, 2012. As 
of the date
of this report, PEMEX&#146;s management is in the process of evaluating the
impact these developments will have on its investment in Repsol. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">F-38
</FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>NOTE 13&#151;EXPLANATION OF TRANSITION TO IFRS 
</B></FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As stated in Note 2(b), 2012 is the first year 
in which PEMEX has prepared its unaudited condensed consolidated interim
financial statements in accordance with IFRS. The accounting policies set out in
Note 3 have been applied in preparing these unaudited condensed consolidated 
interim financial statements as of and for the six months ended June 30, 2012, 
the
comparative information as of and for the year ended December 31, 2011 and in 
the preparation of the opening statement of financial position at January 1, 
2011 (PEMEX transition date). </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In preparing its opening IFRS statement of 
financial position, PEMEX has adjusted amounts reported previously in financial 
statements
prepared in accordance with Mexican FRS. An explanation of how the transition 
from previous Mexican FRS to IFRS has affected PEMEX&#146;s financial position, 
comprehensive income and cash flows, as well as explanations of variations in 
IFRS
adjustments, are set out in the following tables and the notes thereto: 
</FONT></P>

STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">F-39
</FONT></P>

<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>PETR&Oacute;LEOS MEXICANOS, SUBSIDIARY 
ENTITIES AND SUBSIDIARY COMPANIES
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>NOTES TO THE UNAUDITED CONDENSED
CONSOLIDATED </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>INTERIM FINANCIAL STATEMENTS </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>AS OF JUNE 30, 2012, DECEMBER 
31, 2011 AND JANUARY 1, 2011 AND </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>FOR THE
THREE- AND SIX-MONTH PERIODS ENDED JUNE 30, 2012 AND 2011 </B></FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(Figures stated in thousands of Mexican 
pesos (Note 2))
</B></FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT 
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">Reconciliation of financial position at June 30, 2011 from 
Mexican FRS to IFRS: </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-
COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="center">

<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

ENTITIES AND SUBSIDIARY COMPANIES
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>NOTES TO THE UNAUDITED CONDENSED
CONSOLIDATED </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>AS OF JUNE 30, 2012, DECEMBER 
31, 2011 AND JANUARY 1, 2011 AND </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-

Roman" SIZE="2"><B>FOR THE
THREE- AND SIX-MONTH PERIODS ENDED JUNE 30, 2012 AND 2011 </B></FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(Figures stated in thousands of Mexican 
pesos (Note 2))
</B></FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT 
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">Reconciliation of comprehensive income for the six-month period 
ended June&nbsp;30, 2011 from Mexican
FRS to IFRS: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>PETR&Oacute;LEOS MEXICANOS, SUBSIDIARY 
ENTITIES AND SUBSIDIARY COMPANIES

STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>NOTES TO THE UNAUDITED CONDENSED
CONSOLIDATED </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>INTERIM FINANCIAL STATEMENTS </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>AS OF JUNE 30, 2012, DECEMBER 
31, 2011 AND JANUARY 1, 2011 AND </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>FOR THE
THREE- AND SIX-MONTH PERIODS ENDED JUNE 30, 2012 AND 2011 </B></FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(Figures stated in thousands of Mexican 
pesos (Note 2))

SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>

instruments</FONT></P></TD>

 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">F-45
</FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>PETR&Oacute;LEOS MEXICANOS, SUBSIDIARY 
ENTITIES AND SUBSIDIARY COMPANIES
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>NOTES TO THE UNAUDITED CONDENSED
CONSOLIDATED </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>INTERIM FINANCIAL STATEMENTS </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>AS OF JUNE 30, 2012, DECEMBER 
31, 2011 AND JANUARY 1, 2011 AND </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>FOR THE
THREE- AND SIX-MONTH PERIODS ENDED JUNE 30, 2012 AND 2011 </B></FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(Figures stated in thousands of Mexican 
pesos (Note 2))
</B></FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT 
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Notes to the reconciliation of the statement of financial 
position at January&nbsp;1, 2011,
(transition date) and December&nbsp;31, 2011. </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>1. Cash and cash equivalents </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">FRS C-1 &#147;Cash and cash equivalents&#148; 
requires restricted cash to be presented as part of the cash and cash 
equivalents line item;
but under IAS 1, &#147;Presentation of Financial Statements&#148; restricted 
cash must be presented separately from &#147;cash and cash equivalents&#148; on 
the statement of financial position. PEMEX has therefore reclassified 
Ps.&nbsp;2,404,154 and
Ps.&nbsp;2,731,875 as of January&nbsp;1, 2011 and December&nbsp;31, 2011, 
respectively, from &#147;cash and cash equivalents&#148; under Mexican FRS to 
&#147;permanent investments in shares of non-consolidated subsidiaries, 
associates and
others&#148; under IFRS. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-
bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2"><B>2. Inventories </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-
bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Certain components of &#147;wells, 
pipelines, properties, plants and equipment&#148; (spare parts) were classified 
in the line item &#147;inventories&#148; under Mexican FRS. However; these 
components
were classified as fixed assets in accordance with IAS 16 &#147;Property, Plant 
and Equipment&#148;. Accordingly, PEMEX reclassified Ps. 1,250,995 and Ps. 
647,340 as of January&nbsp;1, 2011 and December&nbsp;31, 2011, respectively, 
from
&#147;inventories&#148; under Mexican FRS to &#147;wells, pipelines, properties,
plants and equipment&#148; under IFRS. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">As of
December&nbsp;31, 2011, effects in inventories arising from adjustments to 
employee benefits and from the depreciation and amortization of different parts 
of fixed assets resulted in an increase in inventories and a decrease in the 
cost of sales for
the year for Ps. 1,593,961. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-
bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2"><B>3. Derivative Financial Instruments </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Derivative financial instruments 
(&#147;DFIs&#148;) were recognized at fair value as the transition date. This 
fair value was subsequently
modified to include the counterparty risk in the valuation method, which 
resulted in a decrease in other current assets of Ps. 1,345,960 and an increase 
in accounts payable and others of Ps. 95,560, as of January&nbsp;1, 2011 which 
was comprised of
a debit recorded in accumulated losses. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2">The decrease of Ps. 1,377,036 in other current assets and 
decrease in accounts
payable and others of Ps. 78,350 as of December&nbsp;31, 2011 and a 
corresponding credit to financial instruments, resulted from changes in fair 
value computation methods as well as to the liquidation of positions during the 
period. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>4. Wells, pipelines, properties, plant and 
equipment </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In accordance with IFRS 1, PEMEX 
chose to measure certain wells, pipelines, offshore platforms and drilling 
equipment at their fair value as of the transition date to IFRS, and to use that
fair value as
the deemed cost of those assets. As a result, PEMEX recognized a 
Ps.&nbsp;472,750,354 increase in the fair value of plants, pipelines, offshore 
platforms and drilling equipment as of January&nbsp;1, 2011, which was 
recognized against accumulated
losses. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">F-46
</FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>PETR&Oacute;LEOS MEXICANOS, SUBSIDIARY 
ENTITIES AND SUBSIDIARY COMPANIES
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>NOTES TO THE UNAUDITED CONDENSED
CONSOLIDATED </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>INTERIM FINANCIAL STATEMENTS </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>AS OF JUNE 30, 2012, DECEMBER 
31, 2011 AND JANUARY 1, 2011 AND </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>FOR THE
THREE- AND SIX-MONTH PERIODS ENDED JUNE 30, 2012 AND 2011 </B></FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(Figures stated in thousands of Mexican 
pesos (Note 2))
</B></FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT 
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In addition IAS 16 requires the identification 
on a separate basis of parts of an asset
that have different expected patterns of future economic benefits, with 
depreciation calculated separately by part. As of December&nbsp;31, 2011, the 
net effect of the depreciation for the year resulted in a debit to cost of sales
and operating
expenses of Ps. 28,469,974. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-
bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" 
SIZE="2">As of December&nbsp;31, 2011, some cash-generating units had improved 
economic conditions, which
allowed PEMEX to increase their carrying value and to reverse Ps. 5,376,266 of 
impairment previously recognized in other revenues. </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">PEMEX reclassified costs of 
exploratory wells, not associated with any reserve, from the fixed assets to 
intangible assets until it is determined if they are subject to capitalization 
in accordance with
IFRS 6, in the amount of Ps. 9,231,901 at January&nbsp;1, 2011 and Ps. 9,552,703
at December&nbsp;31, 2011. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-
bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">During the second
quarter of 2012, PEMEX modified its accounting policy regarding the selection of
certain types of fixed assets for initial valuation at fair value in accordance 
with IFRS 1. As a result, PEMEX recognized a decrease of 3.1% and 2.2% in the 
total
amount of fixed assets as of January 1, 2011 and December 31, 2011, 
respectively, as well as a decrease in depreciation expense of approximately 
5.0% for both the six months ended June 30, 2011 and the year ended December 31,
2011. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>5. Easements and rights of way 
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Certain expenditures related to 
easements and rights of way were classified in the line items wells, pipelines, 
properties, plant and equipment or in accumulated losses under Mexican FRS as of
the
transition date. However, under IFRS these easements and rights of way are 
identified as intangible assets. As a result, PEMEX recognized intangible assets
as of January&nbsp;1, 2011, in an amount of Ps. 1,218,860, comprised of 
(i)&nbsp;a
reclassification of easements and rights of way in the amount of Ps. 830,684 
from the line item &#147;wells, pipelines, properties, plant and equipment&#148;
to the line item &#147;intangible assets&#148; and (ii)&nbsp;a credit recognized
against
accumulated losses in the amount of Ps.&nbsp;388,176. </FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As of December&nbsp;31, 2011, the effect of 
rights of way was Ps.
1,134,075, comprised of (i)&nbsp;Ps. 845,681 from the line item &#147;wells, 
pipelines, properties, plant and equipment&#148; to the line item 
&#147;intangible assets&#148; and (ii)&nbsp;a credit recognized against 
accumulated losses and net loss
for the year in the amount of Ps. 288,394. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>6. Long term debt </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As of December&nbsp;31, 2011, under IFRS, PEMEX
recognized an amortized cost effect of debt in the amount of Ps. 4,435. 
</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>7. Employee benefits </B></FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">PEMEX chose the early adoption of 
IAS 19 for employee benefits, as described in Note&nbsp;2(b) (iii). As a result,
unamortized cumulative actuarial net gains under Mexican FRS as of 
January&nbsp;1, 2011
of Ps.&nbsp;123,150,302 were recognized, resulting in an increase in the reserve
for employee benefits and a corresponding increase in accumulated losses on the 
initial statement of financial position under IFRS. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">F-47
</FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>PETR&Oacute;LEOS MEXICANOS, SUBSIDIARY 
ENTITIES AND SUBSIDIARY COMPANIES
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>NOTES TO THE UNAUDITED CONDENSED
CONSOLIDATED </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>INTERIM FINANCIAL STATEMENTS </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>AS OF JUNE 30, 2012, DECEMBER 
31, 2011 AND JANUARY 1, 2011 AND </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>FOR THE
THREE- AND SIX-MONTH PERIODS ENDED JUNE 30, 2012 AND 2011 </B></FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(Figures stated in thousands of Mexican 
pesos (Note 2))
</B></FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT 
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In addition, PEMEX eliminated the component of 
termination benefits from the liability
for employee benefits under Mexican FRS, with a resulting amount of 
Ps.&nbsp;2,485,764 credited against accumulated losses on the initial statement 
of financial position under IFRS. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As of December&nbsp;31, 2011, the net effect in
the reserve for employee benefits (in addition to the items described above) was
a
decrease of Ps. 8,243,929, which was comprised of (i)&nbsp;an increase in 
comprehensive loss in the amount of Ps.&nbsp;26,031,268 and (ii)&nbsp;a decrease
in cost of sales and operating costs and expenses in the amount of 
Ps.&nbsp;34,275,197.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT 
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>8. Deferred taxes 
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As a result of the change in the 
book basis of assets and liabilities from the transition to IFRS, deferred tax 
assets increased in the amount of Ps. 44,230 as compared to the amount 
recognized previously
under Mexican FRS, offset by an increase in deferred tax liabilities in the 
amount of Ps. 20,396,687. Both increases were recognized against accumulated 
losses in the statement of financial position as of January&nbsp;1, 2011. 
</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2011 
deferred tax assets recorded a decrease of Ps.&nbsp;423,967 and deferred tax 
liabilities
recorded an increase of Ps. 19,681,024. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>9. Recognition of inflationary effects </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">PEMEX recognized inflation effects in respect 
of its Certificates of Contribution &#147;A&#148; and contributions of the 
Mexican
Government prior to December&nbsp;31, 1997, the date on which Mexican economy 
was no longer considered hyperinflationary. As a result inflation effects 
recognized after this date in the amount of Ps. 49,043,180 were reclassified to 
accumulated
losses in the opening statement of financial position under IFRS as of 
January&nbsp;1, 2011. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; 
text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>10. Other 
comprehensive
result </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-
left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Foreign currency 
translation </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-
indent:4%"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In accordance with IFRS 1, PEMEX 
chose to cancel the accumulated gains and losses from the translation of foreign
currency amounts, and to value the cumulative currency translation effects for 
all foreign
operations at zero as of January&nbsp;1, 2011, with a debit of 
Ps.&nbsp;4,628,672 recorded in accumulated losses in the initial statement of 
financial position under IFRS. This adjustment did not impact the total value of
equity. </FONT></P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">F-48
</FONT></P>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>PETR&Oacute;LEOS MEXICANOS, SUBSIDIARY 
ENTITIES AND SUBSIDIARY COMPANIES
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>NOTES TO THE UNAUDITED CONDENSED
CONSOLIDATED </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>INTERIM FINANCIAL STATEMENTS </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>AS OF JUNE 30, 2012, DECEMBER 
31, 2011 AND JANUARY 1, 2011 AND </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>FOR THE
THREE- AND SIX-MONTH PERIODS ENDED JUNE 30, 2012 AND 2011 </B></FONT></P> <P 
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(Figures stated in thousands of Mexican 
pesos (Note 2))
</B></FONT></P> <p STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT 
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Accumulated losses and comprehensive result 
</I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Except for reclassified items, all of the 
adjustments related to the adoption of IFRS were recognized in accumulated 
losses and
comprehensive result as of January&nbsp;1, 2011. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-
top:18px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New 
Roman" SIZE="2"><B>11. Cash Flow Statements </B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-
family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The IFRS adoption adjustments described above 
did not affect PEMEX&#146;s cash flows, as shown in the line item &#147;cash and
cash
equivalents&#148; in the statement of financial position. </FONT></P>
